Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First I need to figure out which cases are taking too long The task says to identify cases with significantly longer durations The way to do that is to calculate the total duration for each case from the first event Submit Claim to the last Close Claim

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the table each case has multiple entries Let me list each case and calculate their durations Starting with Case 2001 1 hour and 30 minutes Case 2002 25 hours and 55 minutes Case 2003 48h20m Case 2004 1 hour 25 minutes Case 2005 approximately 85 hours

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So cases 2002 2003 and 2005 have durations longer than the others The others 2001 and 2004 are quick So those three cases are the ones with performance issues

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Next I need to analyze the attributes for these cases Lets look at each of these cases Starting with Case 2002 Region B Complexity Medium Request Additional Documents maybe the Approve step took a long time Wait from 1400 on the first to Approve on the 2nd at 1000 Thats about 25 hours minus the time between the last Request and Approve Maybe the Approver took too long But the Approver here is Manager Ann same as in other cases Hmm Alternatively maybe the Request step requires the customer to send documents leading to waiting time

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 2003 is Region A High Complexity It has multiple Request Additional Documents steps three times

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait looking at the data the entries for 2003 show two Request Docs on the same day April 1 at 1100 and 1700 So thats two instances on the same day

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So the multiple requests and the complexity being high might be the cause here

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 2005 is Region B High Complexity They have three instances of Request Additional Documents spaced out over days

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait no looking at the data for 2005 The events are on 2024 04 01 1130 then again on 2nd at 1700 Wait no the entries for 2005 The third entry is Request Additional Documents at 1130 on 04 01 then another on 04 02 1700 and another on 04 03 1500 So thats three requests each taking days between

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Thats definitely contributing to the long duration

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now looking at the attributes For the three problematic cases Complexity seems to play a role because the two high complexity cases 2003 and 2005 are the longest and 2002 medium is longer than the low ones 2001 and 2004

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait the low complexity cases 2001 and 2004 are quick so high complexity definitely contributes

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So the first thought is that High Complexity cases take longer especially with multiple Request Additional Docs steps Additionally looking at the number of Request Docs steps

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 2002 has one Request Docs Case 2003 has two Request Docs on the same day Wait no looking at 2003s log two Request Docs entries on the same day Case 2005 has three Request Docs entries spread over three days

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Hmm but even with two requests on the same day the process might have to wait for the customers response each time which could take time So each Request would add time for the customer to respond leading to delays

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the number of Request Docs steps is a clear factor High complexity cases have more Request steps leading to longer durations

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Additionally looking at the Resources assigned to these cases Adjuster Mike Adjuster Lisa Maybe Manager Bill has a higher volume leading to delays

Name: Validation - PE
Text: But perhaps thats not the case The main issue is the requests

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Looking at the Regions Case 2002 Region B Case 2003 Region A Case 2005 Region B Region might not be directly the cause but combined with Complexity

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Wait 2002 Region B medium took longer than 2004 Region B low So perhaps Complexity is the main driver

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Thus the root causes are High complexity claims require more steps more Requests for docs leading to longer durations The number of Request steps is directly causing delays because each request adds waiting time Therefore the root causes are the Complexity of the claim leading to more Request steps which require customer responses increasing the total duration
